title: Flooding Chaos in Yellowstone, a Sign of Crises to Come
abstract: Record rainfall and mudslides forced closures just as tourism season ramped up. Virtually none of America’s national parks are untouched by extreme weather and climate change.
byline: By Jim Robbins, Thomas Fuller and Christine Chung

multimedia.caption: The Yellowstone River flooding parts of Paradise Valley, a northern corridor to Yellowstone National Park.

title: A Decade After DACA, the Rise of a New Generation of Undocumented Students
abstract: A vast majority of undocumented teenagers are graduating high school this year without protection from deportation and the ability to legally work.
des_facet: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)

multimedia.caption: Tommy Esquivel said goodbye to his science teacher, Alycia Escobedo, at Hollywood High School in Los Angeles. He has had to pass up career-building opportunities because of his undocumented status.
multimedia.copyright: Jenna Schoenefeld for The New York Times

abstract: Flooding and mudslides from recent storms have collapsed bridges and washed away roads in the national park.

title: Southern Baptists Elect New Leader Amid Deepening Divisions
abstract: The nation’s largest Protestant denomination, a bellwether for conservative Christianity, chose a rural Texas pastor and approved actions to address its sex abuse crisis.

title: At least 16 others from the overheated tractor-trailer were taken to hospitals.
abstract: At least 16 others from the tractor-trailer in San Antonio, including some children, were taken to hospitals. Three people were in custody, officials said.
byline: By James Dobbins, J. David Goodman and Daniel Victor

title: What We Know About the Migrant Deaths in San Antonio
abstract: Authorities are working to identify the dozens of victims, who are believed to be migrants. Three people have been detained. And local police planned to search the site for more bodies on Tuesday.

title: F.D.A. advisers meet for discussion on the options for updating Covid vaccines in anticipation of possible surges.
abstract: The expert panel will vote at the end of the daylong meeting on whether the vaccines should be reformulated to target Omicron or one of its subvariants, BA.4 and BA.5.

title: Democrats Press the White House for a More Assertive Response to Roe’s Fall
abstract: The initial response by President Biden and other Democratic leaders to the overturning of Roe struck many Democrats as painfully inadequate.

title: A pandemic-related health order has contributed to a surge in border crossings.
abstract: Technically, the border is closed to most migrants under a 2020 order. But the policy, known as Title 42, has had the unintended effect of encouraging people to repeatedly attempt to cross the border.

multimedia.caption: A migrant-led vigil in response to the extension of Title 42, at the DeConcini Port of Entry in Nogales, Mexico, in May.

title: In Illinois, MAGA Congresswoman Rallies to Oust Her G.O.P. Colleague
abstract: The primary contest between Republican Representatives Mary Miller and Rodney Davis has pitted a hard-right figure styling herself in Trump’s image against a traditional, pragmatic conservative.

title: Gov. Abbott has made crackdown on migrants central to his re-election campaign.
abstract: The governor has boasted of his tough stance against migrants, but his policies have failed to slow the number of people crossing the border.

title: These are some of the deadliest instances of migrant deaths on the southern border.
abstract: The journey north for migrants crossing into the U.S. from Mexico is typically dangerous, and sometimes fatal. In recent years, dozens of migrants have died in crashes while traveling north.

title: Ed Gonzalez, Biden’s Long-Stalled Nominee to Lead ICE, Withdraws
abstract: His 14-month nomination was ensnared by immigration politics and allegations of domestic abuse, and his departure is another blow to the Biden administration on an issue where it has struggled.

multimedia.caption: In a letter to the president, Ed Gonzalez, a fierce critic of hard-line policies at the agency he was tapped to lead, said he had withdrawn “in the best interest of the nation.”

title: A Rhode Island candidate was charged after a video showed him punching an opponent at an abortion protest.

title: Alameda County, Calif., home to Oakland, drops its indoor mask mandate after three weeks.
abstract: Daily coronavirus case rates in the county are falling, and while the number of residents hospitalized remains high, daily new admissions have stabilized, health officials said.
